title: 104_hr2295
content: The "Discretionary Spending Reduction and Control Act of 1995" may be cited as such. It includes discretionary spending limits. The "Discretionary Spending Reduction and Control Act of 1995" sets new budget authority and outlay limits for defense and nondefense categories for fiscal years 1996 and 1997. The "Discretionary Spending Reduction and Control Act of 1995" establishes budget authority and outlay limits for defense and nondefense categories for fiscal years 1996, 1997, 1998, and 1999. For fiscal year 1996, the defense category has $267,962,000,000 in new budget authority and $265,734,000,000 in outlays, while the nondefense category has $214,468,000,000 in new budget authority and $254,561,000,000 in outlays. For fiscal year 1998, the defense category has $269,731,000,000 in new budget authority and $264,531,000,000 in outlays, and the nondefense category has $220,961,000,000 in new budget authority and $248,101,000,000 in outlays. For fiscal year 1999, the discretionary category has $482,207,000,000 in new budget authority and $510,482,000,000 in outlays. The "Discretionary Spending Reduction and Control Act of 1995" sets budget authority and outlay limits for fiscal years 1996-2002. For fiscal year 2000, the discretionary category has $489,379,000,000 in new budget authority and $514,234,000,000 in outlays. For fiscal year 2002, the discretionary category has $498,837,000,000 in new budget authority and $515,075,000,000 in outlays. Amendments are made to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 regarding committee allocations and enforcement. Amendments are made to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974, changing the budget resolutions for fiscal years 1995 to 2002. The effective date is updated to 2002, and adjustments are made to the Sequestration Regarding Crime Trust Fund. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 include new budget authority levels for fiscal years 1996 to 2000. Additionally, the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 has its last two sentences repealed. SEC. 3. GENERAL STATEMENT AND DEFINITIONS. Section 250(b) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to enforce deficit reduction through spending limits and pay-as-you-go requirements for fiscal years 1995 through 2002. Definitions in Section 250(c) are updated, including the term 'category' referring to all discretionary appropriations and 'budgetary resources' encompassing various financial authorities. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to enforce deficit reduction through spending limits and pay-as-you-go requirements for fiscal years 1995 through 2002. Amendments include updating definitions in Section 250(c) and redesignating paragraphs in the legislation. SEC. 4. ENFORCING DISCRETIONARY SPENDING LIMITS. Section 251 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to update the years and adjustments specified in subsections (a) and (b). The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended to update the specified years and adjustments in subsections (a) and (b) through 2002. Subsection (b)(2) is modified by removing subparagraphs (A), (B), and (C), updating clauses in subsection (b)(2)(E), and limiting adjustments in outlays for fiscal years 1996-2002 to 0.5 percent of the adjusted discretionary spending limit. SEC. 5. ENFORCING PAY-AS-YOU-GO. Amendments made to Section 252 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 update the specified years to 1995-2002. SEC. 6. REPORTS AND ORDERS. Changes in Section 254 of the Act update the specified years to 2002. SEC. 7. TECHNICAL CORRECTION. SEC. 7. TECHNICAL CORRECTION. Section 258 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is repealed. SEC. 8. EFFECTIVE DATE. Amendments update the expiration years to 2002 for certain sections of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 and the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993.
